cards.name: Splinterfright
cards.text:
Trample
Splinterfright's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

rulings.text: The ability that defines Splinterfright's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Splinterfright is in your graveyard, it will count itself.
If Splinterfright's controller has only one card in their library, they put that card into their graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Splinterfright's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.name: Travel Preparations
cards.text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Visiting a shrine at the start of a journey makes the traveler more likely to finish it.

rulings.text: You can't target the same creature twice to put two +1/+1 counters on it.
If Travel Preparations targets two creatures, and one of them is an illegal target by the time Travel Preparations resolves, you'll still put a +1/+1 counter on the other creature.

cards.originalText:
Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Tree of Redemption
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.
cards.flavor: The executioner's tree in Thraben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.

rulings.text: If Tree of Redemption isn't on the battlefield when its activated ability resolves, the exchange can't happen and the ability will have no effect.

When its activated ability resolves, Tree of Redemption's toughness will become your former life total and you will gain or lose an amount of life necessary so that your life total equals Tree of Redemption's former toughness. Other effects that interact with life gain or life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.

Any toughness-modifying effects, counters, Auras, or Equipment will apply after its toughness is set to your former life total. For example, say Tree of Redemption is enchanted with Lunarch Mantle (which makes it 2/15) and your life total is 7. After the exchange, Tree of Redemption would be a 2/9 creature (its toughness became 7, which was then modified by Lunarch Mantle) and your life total would be 15.

cards.originalText:
Defender
{T}: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption's toughness.

cards.name: Ulvenwald Mystics
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Ulvenwald Mystics.
cards.flavor: "With this ritual, we cast aside our fragile humanity . . ."

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

foreignNames.name: ウルヴェンワルドの神秘家

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Ulvenwald Mystics.

cards.name: Ulvenwald Primordials
cards.text:
{G}: Regenerate Ulvenwald Primordials.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ulvenwald Primordials.
cards.flavor: ". . . and embrace the ancient ferocity of the undying Wild."

rulings.text: You can regenerate Ulvenwald Primordials in response to the triggered ability that would transform it. If you do, the regeneration shield will apply to Ulvenwald Mystics that turn.

foreignNames.name: ウルヴェンワルドの根源

cards.originalText:
{G}: Regenerate Ulvenwald Primordials.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ulvenwald Primordials.

cards.name: Villagers of Estwald
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Villagers of Estwald.
cards.flavor: You can spot a werewolf-infested town by its lack of butcher shops.

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Villagers of Estwald.

cards.name: Howlpack of Estwald
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack of Estwald.
cards.flavor: Estwald's citizens don't dislike outsiders—they taste just fine.

foreignNames.name: エストワルドの吠え群れ

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack of Estwald.

cards.name: Woodland Sleuth
cards.text: Morbid — When Woodland Sleuth enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Whatever did this is near. Death reversion has not yet occurred. Be alert!"

rulings.text: The creature card isn't chosen at random until the ability resolves.
Woodland Sleuth could die in response to its own morbid ability. If this happens, the ability could return Woodland Sleuth to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText: Morbid — When Woodland Sleuth enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Wreath of Geists
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Before you travel the woods of Kessig, first get permission from those who died trying.

rulings.text: The value of X is constantly updated as creature cards are put into or removed from your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Evil Twin
cards.text: You may have Evil Twin enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it has "{U}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with the same name as this creature."
cards.flavor: You can always tell the evil one by the dagger he's sticking in you.

rulings.text: Evil Twin copies exactly what was printed on the original creature (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below) and it gains the activated ability. It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or any Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
The activated ability that Evil Twin gains as part of its copy effect is a copiable value that other effects may copy.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Evil Twin), then your Evil Twin enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Evil Twin copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that created the token. Evil Twin is not a token in this case.

Unless a token is a copy of another creature or was explicitly given a name by the effect that created it, its name is the creature types it was given when it was created. For example, the Beast tokens created by Thragtusk and by Baloth Cage Trap are both named "Beast."

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Evil Twin enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If Evil Twin somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Evil Twin can't become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that's already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Evil Twin enters the battlefield as a 0/0 creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.

cards.originalText: You may have Evil Twin enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield except it gains "{U}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with the same name as this creature."

cards.name: Geist of Saint Traft
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Geist of Saint Traft attacks, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying that's tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.

rulings.text: You declare which player or planeswalker the token is attacking as you put it onto the battlefield. It doesn't have to be the same player or planeswalker Geist of Saint Traft is attacking.
Although the token is attacking, it was never declared as an attacking creature (for purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

cards.originalText:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever Geist of Saint Traft attacks, put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield tapped and attacking. Exile that token at end of combat.

cards.name: Grimgrin, Corpse-Born
cards.text:
Grimgrin, Corpse-Born enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
Sacrifice another creature: Untap Grimgrin and put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever Grimgrin attacks, destroy target creature defending player controls, then put a +1/+1 counter on Grimgrin.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Grimgrin's last ability resolves, the entire ability doesn't resolve and none of its effects will occur. You won't put a +1/+1 counter on Grimgrin.
If the defending player controls no creatures when Grimgrin attacks, the last ability will be removed from the stack and have no effect.
If Grimgrin's last ability resolves, but the targeted creature isn't destroyed (perhaps because it regenerated or has indestructible), you'll still put a +1/+1 on Grimgrin.

foreignNames.name: 死体生まれのグリムグリン

cards.originalText:
Grimgrin, Corpse-Born enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
Sacrifice another creature: Untap Grimgrin and put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever Grimgrin attacks, destroy target creature defending player controls, then put a +1/+1 counter on Grimgrin.

cards.name: Olivia Voldaren
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Olivia Voldaren deals 1 damage to another target creature. That creature becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types. Put a +1/+1 counter on Olivia Voldaren.
{3}{B}{B}: Gain control of target Vampire for as long as you control Olivia Voldaren.

rulings.text: If Olivia Voldaren deals lethal damage to a creature with its first activated ability, that creature will become a Vampire before dying.

If you activate Olivia Voldaren's last ability, and before that ability resolves you lose control of Olivia Voldaren, the ability will resolve with no effect. You won't gain control of the targeted Vampire.

foreignNames.name: オリヴィア・ヴォルダーレン

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}: Olivia Voldaren deals 1 damage to another target creature. That creature becomes a Vampire in addition to its other types. Put a +1/+1 counter on Olivia Voldaren.
{3}{B}{B}: Gain control of target Vampire for as long as you control Olivia Voldaren.

cards.name: Blazing Torch
cards.text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked by Vampires or Zombies.
Equipped creature has "{T}, Sacrifice Blazing Torch: Blazing Torch deals 2 damage to any target."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: If a Blazing Torch controlled by one player somehow winds up equipping a creature a different player controls, the damage ability can't be activated by either player. Only the creature's controller may activate the ability — but since that player can't sacrifice Blazing Torch (a permanent they don't control), the ability's cost can't be paid.

The source of the damage is Blazing Torch, not the equipped creature. However, the equipped creature's ability is what targets the permanent or player. If Blazing Torch is equipped to a red creature, for example, the ability couldn't target a creature with protection from red. It could target a creature with protection from artifacts, but all the damage would be prevented.

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature can't be blocked by Vampires or Zombies.
Equipped creature has "{T}, Sacrifice Blazing Torch: Blazing Torch deals 2 damage to target creature or player."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Butcher's Cleaver
cards.flavor: Outside the safety of Thraben, there is little distinction between tool and weapon.

cards.name: Cellar Door
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the bottom card of their library into their graveyard. If it's a creature card, you create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: As if anyone needed another reason to avoid dark, dank cellars.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the bottom card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If it's a creature card, you put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Cobbled Wings
cards.text:
Equipped creature has flying.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: For the necro-alchemist, any puzzle can be solved with intelligence and harvested body parts.
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature has flying.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Creepy Doll
cards.text:
Indestructible
Whenever Creepy Doll deals combat damage to a creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy that creature.
cards.flavor: A child's porcelain doll went missing one night, as did a pair of kitchen shears and the town magistrate.

rulings.text: You don't flip the coin until the ability resolves. If you want to respond to the ability, perhaps by regenerating the damaged creature, you'll have to do so before you know the outcome of the flip.

If the combat damage Creepy Doll deals to a creature is lethal, you'll still flip a coin. If the creature is still on the battlefield (perhaps because it regenerated), it could be destroyed a second time, depending on the coin flip.

cards.originalText:
Creepy Doll is indestructible.
Whenever Creepy Doll deals combat damage to a creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Demonmail Hauberk
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +4/+2.
Equip—Sacrifice a creature.
cards.flavor: It comes off as easily as your own skin.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice the creature Demonmail Hauberk is equipping in order to equip it to another creature.

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +4/+2.
Equip—Sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Galvanic Juggernaut
cards.text:
Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Galvanic Juggernaut doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.
cards.originalText:
Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Galvanic Juggernaut doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.

cards.name: Geistcatcher's Rig
cards.text: When Geistcatcher's Rig enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 4 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The rigs were outlawed except in Nephalia, where malign spirits are as plentiful as crazed inventors.

rulings.text: The target creature with flying is chosen when the ability triggers and goes on the stack. You choose whether or not Geistcatcher's Rig will deal 4 damage to it when then ability resolves.

cards.originalText: When Geistcatcher's Rig enters the battlefield, you may have it deal 4 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Ghoulcaller's Bell
cards.text: {T}: Each player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: The bell's chime heralds the rise of the unhallowed from the grave and the fall of their victims into the earth.
cards.originalText: {T}: Each player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Graveyard Shovel
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player exiles a card from their graveyard. If it's a creature card, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Thanks to Havengul's thriving illegal market for corpses, the shovel that interred a body during the day is usually the same one digging it out at night.

rulings.text: The targeted player chooses which card to exile when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard. If it's a creature card, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Grimoire of the Dead
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a study counter on Grimoire of the Dead.
{T}, Remove three study counters from Grimoire of the Dead and sacrifice it: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control. They're black Zombies in addition to their other colors and types.

rulings.text: "Creature cards" includes each card with the type creature, even if it has additional types, such as artifact.

cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}, Discard a card: Put a study counter on Grimoire of the Dead.
{T}, Remove three study counters from Grimoire of the Dead and sacrifice it: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control. They're black Zombies in addition to their other colors and types.

cards.name: Inquisitor's Flail

rulings.text: If a creature is equipped with a second Inquisitor's Flail, combat damage dealt by and dealt to that creature will be multiplied by four. A third Inquisitor's Flail would multiply the combat damage by eight, and so on.

If you divide the combat damage dealt by the equipped creature, perhaps because the creature has trample or is dealing combat damage to multiple creatures, you'll divide the original amount and then double the results. For example, if a 5/5 creature with trample is blocked by a 2/2 creature, you can assign 2 damage to the blocker and 3 damage to the defending player. These amounts are then doubled to 4 and 6 damage, respectively. You can't double the damage to 10 first and then assign 2 to the creature and 8 to the player.

cards.name: Manor Gargoyle
cards.text:
Defender
Manor Gargoyle has indestructible as long as it has defender.
{1}: Until end of turn, Manor Gargoyle loses defender and gains flying.
cards.flavor: Nothing could break it but the fall.

rulings.text: Lethal damage dealt to Manor Gargoyle while it has indestructible will stay marked on it that turn. If Manor Gargoyle loses indestructible after having been dealt lethal damage earlier in the turn, it will be destroyed.

cards.originalText:
Defender
Manor Gargoyle is indestructible as long as it has defender.
{1}: Until end of turn, Manor Gargoyle loses defender and gains flying.

cards.name: Mask of Avacyn
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2 and has hexproof. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Equip {3}
cards.flavor: It hides the face and protects the soul.

rulings.text: If Mask of Avacyn somehow becomes attached to a creature an opponent controls, that creature can't be the target of spells or abilities you control.

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+2 and has hexproof. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.text:

cards.name: Sharpened Pitchfork
cards.flavor: Not everyone can have a sword of blessed silver. Not everyone needs one, either.

cards.name: Silver-Inlaid Dagger
cards.flavor: Magical etchings turned a whittler's tool into a wolfhunter's weapon.

cards.name: Traveler's Amulet
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Traveler's Amulet: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The rider set off into the eerie mist, swaddled in armor and laden with amulets.
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Traveler's Amulet: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Trepanation Blade
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, defending player reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a land card. The creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each card revealed this way. That player puts the revealed cards into their graveyard.
Equip {2}

rulings.text: The land card is counted when calculating the bonus, and it will be put into the graveyard with the other revealed cards.
If the equipped creature is attacking a planeswalker, the controller of the planeswalker is the defending player.

cards.originalText:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, defending player reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card. The creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each card revealed this way. That player puts the revealed cards into his or her graveyard.
Equip {2}

Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: The Vampire is destroyed before any combat damage is dealt.

cards.name: Clifftop Retreat

Clifftop Retreat enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Plains.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.
cards.flavor: Where cathars learn to fight not only demons and vampires, but ignorance as well.
cards.originalText:
Clifftop Retreat enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Plains.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Gavony Township
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}{G}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"The protective wards of the church have weakened, and no one can tell us why. It's time to look to our own defenses."
—Gregel, militia leader
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{G}{W}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Ghost Quarter
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle their library.
cards.flavor: Deserted, but not uninhabited.

rulings.text: If you target Ghost Quarter with its own ability, the ability won't resolve because its target is no longer on the battlefield. You won't get to search for a land card.

If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Ghost Quarter's ability resolves, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. The land's controller won't get to search for a basic land card.

The target land's controller gets to search for a basic land card even if that land wasn't destroyed by Ghost Quarter's ability. This may happen because the land has indestructible or because it was regenerated.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ghost Quarter: Destroy target land. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.flavor: In places where the sea meets the trees, it's easy to forget the darkness that rules most of Innistrad.
cards.originalText:
Hinterland Harbor enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or an Island.

cards.name: Alabaster Leech
cards.text: White spells you cast cost {W} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"Its stones seem to serve a healing function, but removing them intact is an exhausting process."
—Tolarian research notes
cards.originalText: White spells you play cost {W} more to play.

cards.name: Angel of Mercy
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"In times like these, people need to be reminded of compassion."
—Sisay
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy comes into play, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Ardent Soldier
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Vigilance
If Ardent Soldier was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you play this spell.)
Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Soldier to tap.
If you paid the kicker cost, Ardent Soldier comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Atalya, Samite Master
cards.text:
{X}, {T}: Choose one —
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Spend only white mana on X.
• You gain X life. Spend only white mana on X.
cards.flavor: "Healing is a gift the divine ones have shared with us. It is a sacred trust."

rulings.text: Cost modifiers which add a cost are not restricted to only white mana.
Spending only white mana applies to the ability regardless of which mode you choose.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Choose one Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn; or you gain X life. Spend only white mana this way.

cards.name: Benalish Emissary
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Benalish Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target land.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you play this spell.)
When Benalish Emissary comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, destroy target land.

cards.name: Benalish Heralds
cards.text: {3}{U}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The detailed dispatch could be summarized in four words: "Time is running out."
cards.originalText: {3}{U}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Benalish Lancer
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W} as you cast this spell.)
If Benalish Lancer was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with first strike.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W} as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Benalish Lancer comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it and has first strike.

cards.name: Benalish Trapper
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: "I'm up here. You're down there. Now who's the lower life form?"
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Blinding Light
cards.text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
cards.flavor: An angel's sword impales only the body; her righteousness penetrates the soul.

rulings.text: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

cards.originalText: Tap all nonwhite creatures.

cards.name: Capashen Unicorn
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Capashen Unicorn: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Capashen riders were stern and humorless even before their ancestral home was reduced to rubble.
cards.originalText: {1}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Capashen Unicorn: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Crimson Acolyte
cards.text:
Protection from red
{W}: Target creature gains protection from red until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
The faithful will walk through streams of fire and emerge unscathed.
—Crimson acolyte creed
cards.originalText:
Protection from red
{W}: Target creature gains protection from red until end of turn.

cards.name: Crusading Knight
cards.text:
Protection from black
Crusading Knight gets +1/+1 for each Swamp your opponents control.
cards.flavor: "My only dream is to destroy the nightmares of others."

rulings.text: It counts all opponents' swamps.

cards.originalText:
Protection from black
Crusading Knight gets +1/+1 for each swamp your opponents control.

cards.name: Death or Glory
cards.text: Separate all creature cards in your graveyard into two piles. Exile the pile of an opponent's choice and return the other to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Separate all creature cards in your graveyard into two face-up piles. Remove the pile of an opponent's choice from the game and return the other to play.

cards.name: Dismantling Blow
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If this spell was kicked, draw two cards.

rulings.text: If the target is not legal on resolution, the spell doesn't resolve and you do not get to draw the two cards.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you play this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
If you paid the kicker cost, draw two cards.

cards.name: Divine Presence
cards.text: If a source would deal 4 or more damage to a permanent or player, that source deals 3 damage to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor:
"Serra's light isn't easily extinguished."
—Reya Dawnbringer

rulings.text: This is not preventing damage since it does not use the word "prevent". It is a replacement.

cards.originalText: If a source would deal 4 damage or more to a creature or player, that source deals 3 damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Fight or Flight
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, separate all creatures that player controls into two piles. Only creatures in the pile of their choice can attack this turn.

rulings.text: Creatures which enter the battlefield (or cards which become creatures) after the beginning of combat ability resolves are not placed in either pile. Since they weren't in the chosen pile, they won't be able to attack.
If you have two of these, then you will separate the creatures into piles twice, and the opponent will choose a pile each time. Only creatures that were in both of the chosen piles can attack.
The effect is best understood if you read it as "creatures not in the chosen pile can't attack."

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's combat phase, separate all creatures that player controls into two face-up piles. Only creatures in the pile of his or her choice may attack this turn.

cards.name: Glimmering Angel
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Glimmering Angel gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"We turned to see where the blow came from and saw only a distant light."
—Capashen lord

rulings.text: You can activate the ability that grants shroud in response to this card being targeted by a spell or ability. If you do so, then (if this is the spell or abilities only target) the spell or ability won't resolve since this card will now be an illegal target.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{U}: Glimmering Angel can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.

cards.name: Global Ruin
cards.text: Each player chooses from the lands they control a land of each basic land type, then sacrifices the rest.
cards.flavor:
"The earth shook, the sky rained fire, and it seemed the world was ending."
—Benalish refugee

rulings.text: If a land counts as multiple basic land types, you can choose it for either or for both of those land types.

You sacrifice all lands other than the chosen ones. Since you can only choose lands with basic land types, any non-basic lands that don't have a basic land type (even if they have some other land type, as in the case of Cloudpost) are necessarily going to be sacrificed.

cards.originalText: Each player chooses from the lands he or she controls a land of each basic land type, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Harsh Judgment
cards.text:
As Harsh Judgment enters the battlefield, choose a color.
If an instant or sorcery spell of the chosen color would deal damage to you, it deals that damage to its controller instead.
cards.flavor:
"At least they remember me."
—Gerrard
cards.originalText:
As Harsh Judgment comes into play, choose a color.
If an instant or sorcery of the chosen color would deal damage to you, it deals that damage to its controller instead.

cards.name: Holy Day
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Will history remember this as the day demons arrived or the day saviors arrived?"
—Barrin
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Liberate
cards.text: Exile target creature you control. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"Not everyone gets a second chance."
—Hanna

rulings.text: The creature returns after "at the beginning of the end step" abilities trigger, so any such abilities on the creature will not trigger this turn.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature you control from the game. At end of turn, return that card to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Obsidian Acolyte
cards.text:
Protection from black
{W}: Target creature gains protection from black until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
The truthful will stand in the gaze of death and escape unharmed.
—Obsidian acolyte creed
cards.originalText:
Protection from black
{W}: Target creature gains protection from black until end of turn.

cards.name: Orim's Touch
cards.text:
Kicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} as you cast this spell.)
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. If this spell was kicked, prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to that permanent or player this turn instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} as you play this spell.)
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. If you paid the kicker cost, prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to that creature or player this turn instead.

cards.name: Pledge of Loyalty
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from the colors of permanents you control. This effect doesn't remove Pledge of Loyalty.
cards.flavor: Urza convinced many Dominarians not only to set aside their differences, but to embrace them.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has protection from the colors of permanents you control. This effect doesn't remove Pledge of Loyalty.

cards.name: Prison Barricade
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you cast this spell.)
If Prison Barricade was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with "Prison Barricade can attack as though it didn't have defender."

rulings.text: If the Prison Barricade is kicked, it enters the battlefield with the ability to attack as if it did not have Defender and will keep this ability until it leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Prison Barricade comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it and may attack as though it weren't a Wall.

cards.name: Protective Sphere
cards.text: {1}, Pay 1 life: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice that shares a color with the mana spent on this activation cost. (Colorless mana prevents no damage.)
cards.originalText: {1}, Pay 1 life: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice that shares a color with the mana spent on this activation cost. (Colorless mana prevents no damage.)

cards.name: Pure Reflection
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, destroy all Reflections. Then that player creates an X/X white Reflection creature token, where X is the converted mana cost of that spell.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a creature spell, destroy all Reflections. Then that player puts a white Reflection creature token into play with power and toughness each equal to the converted mana cost of that spell.

cards.name: Rampant Elephant
cards.text: {G}: Target creature blocks Rampant Elephant this turn if able.
cards.flavor: No matter how righteous the cause, it helps to bring along some muscle.
cards.originalText: {G}: Target creature blocks Rampant Elephant this turn if able.

cards.name: Razorfoot Griffin
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"Do griffins fight to defend their homes or purely for sport?"
—Sisay
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Restrain
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Hanna would give up her own life before she'd abandon the Weatherlight."
—Sisay
cards.originalText:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Reviving Dose
cards.text:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: As healers battled each plague, they learned more about the next.
cards.originalText:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Rewards of Diversity
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a multicolored spell, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"Everything is in place. Nothing can happen that isn't part of my plan."
—Urza
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a multicolored spell, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Reya Dawnbringer
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: A beacon of hope for a battered army.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Rout
cards.text:
You may cast Rout as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
You may play Rout any time you could play an instant if you pay {2} more to play it.
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Ruham Djinn
cards.text:
First strike
Ruham Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as white is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Ruham Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as white is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

cards.name: Samite Ministration
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice. Whenever damage from a black or red source is prevented this way this turn, you gain that much life.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by a source of your choice to you this turn. Whenever damage from a black or red source is prevented this way, you gain life equal to that damage.

cards.name: Shackles
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "It could be worse," said Gerrard, looking around. "Well, maybe not."

rulings.text: Shackles does not tap the creature when it enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Spirit of Resistance
cards.text: As long as you control a permanent of each color, prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.
cards.flavor:
"Our victory must come from all of Dominaria, or it will not come."
—Urza

rulings.text: A permanent which is of multiple colors counts as each of its colors.

cards.originalText: If you control a permanent of each color, prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.
